To apply for the Royal Society's Partnership Grants scheme, you will need to visit their website and complete the online application form. The application form requires some basic information about your school, including its name, location, and number of students. You will also need to provide a brief description of your proposed project, outlining its aims and objectives, and how it relates to climate change and sustainability.

In addition to the application form, you will need to provide a letter of support from the headteacher of your school, as well as a budget plan outlining how you plan to spend the grant money. The Royal Society also requests that you involve your students in the application process and provide evidence of their input, such as drawings or photographs.

Overall, the Partnership Grants scheme provides a valuable opportunity for schools to engage their students in STEM-based projects related to climate change and sustainability. By participating in this program, you can help to raise awareness about these important issues and support the development of future generations who are equipped to make a positive contribution to the effort to address climate change.
